(52817, 55987).name: reservoirs
(52817, 55987).label: location

(52817, 55987).name: aquatic ecosystems
(52817, 55987).label: location
(52817, 55987).description: Ecosystems that exist in or around water, including freshwater and marine environments, and are often affected by climate change

(52817, 55987).name: gravity waves
(52817, 55987).label: natural hazard
(52817, 55987).description: Ripples in the surface of the ocean or atmosphere that can have significant impacts on coastal ecosystems and human activities

(52817, 55987).name: Had-CM3 models
(52817, 55987).label: model
(52817, 55987).description: A type of climate model developed by the Hadley Centre for Climate Prediction and Research, used to simulate and predict climate change

(52817, 55987).name: hydrology
(52817, 55987).label: variable
(52817, 55987).description: The study of the movement, distribution, and quality of water on Earth, often used to understand and predict the impacts of climate change on aquatic ecosystems

(52817, 55987).name: adaptation
(52817, 55987).label: project

(52817, 55987).name: US Department of Energy
(52817, 55987).label: provider
(52817, 55987).description: A government agency responsible for promoting energy security, scientific research, and environmental protection

(52817, 55987).name: National Center for Atmospheric Research
(52817, 55987).label: provider

(52817, 55987).name: Parallel Climate Model
(52817, 55987).label: model
(52817, 55987).description: A type of climate model developed by the National Center for Atmospheric Research, used to simulate and predict climate change

(52817, 55987).name: HEC-HMS model
(52817, 55987).label: model

(55445, 57779).name: aquaculture
(55445, 57779).label: project
(55445, 57779).description: The practice of cultivating aquatic plants and animals, often in controlled environments, for food and other products

(55445, 57779).name: climate change

(55445, 57779).name: native species

(55445, 57779).name: adaptation
